intro: Willardia eriophylla, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters, and the plant is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance. Willardia eriophylla plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes.
